It's strange that Starbucks offer such promotions and yet their staff seem to scorn at customers when informing them that we as the customers are using such promotions!  The attitude of Khaty at Starbucks sucks big time.  The same  type of attitude when collecting the free cold cup yesterday and buying a drink with today's promotions.  Frankly there are alot of other choices around and Starbucks will soon be striked off from my list forever if the staff continues to have such lousy attittude!
I did not have to mention free upgrade as the store informed every customer about this promo and if they want an upgrade.  Cool!

I think Starbucks should work on their customer service. So far, I think that orchard area staffs are ok but there are a selected few in other locations with pretty bad attitudes. Even though I have been patronizing here for years,  I am aware that there are so much more better quality coffees out there at the same value which I have come to realise. So I think you should improve in this aspect to retain customer loyalty.
Remember to show this FB page at the counter. Brought mine at northpoint the person not sure what promo is going on.

1.post_text: Have your Grande-sized beverages upgraded to Venti on us today. Kindly mention "Facebook Treat" to enjoy your upgrade - limited to 4 drinks per redemption, while stocks last.

comments.message:
I think Starbucks Singapore really need to work on your staffs attitude especially if you are doing all these Marketing to pull more users. Been given an annoyed face and a slam on the drinks I ordered on the counter. This while I even ordered a drink before asking if the Cold Cup is still available. 
Kudos to Marketing team but thumbs down for the baristas.
Haha I bought them two years ago 😆

Starbucks. You should not run a promo, especially among your followers, where you run out of the promo item. Your poor planning made many of us run around different outlets for nothing.

You have created a PR nightmare and left a bad taste in your fans' mouth.

This "FREE Cold Cup" was not given free at Jurong Point Starbucks. Starbucks barista told customers need to buy a drink in order to get a free Cold Cup. I had bought a drink to get a Cold Cup. But I'm perplexed that this Cold Cup is given free at other branches but not at Jurong Point Starbucks. Appreciate if an explanation can be given. Thanks.

Sad. Just off work n saw so many ppl said almost all store oos ald. Starbucks should consider change the giving away timing or open a store in Tuas area. Yes, working in Tuas area and definitely can't get things like this if is giving away during working hour n while stock last.
I patron every week. Is so unfair. Some people dont even your regular customers.

So called Wilkie Edge Starbucks, they said they were out of stock at 8 45am. EIGHT. FOURTY-FIVE. AM. 

Seriously starbucks?

*eyeroll*
To me it does not matter wether the merchandise looks CHEAP or EXPENSIVE..Its the thoughts tt count that they hv for their customers!!simple said if it looks cheap dunt get it!!
Suggest to put sign outside store to inform fully redeemed instead of having to queue up.

Should be redeem with purchased. Some people dont even patron at all and they go to different outlets to collect. If must redeem with purchased they wont border to fork out there money so many times a day.

the last time i visited starbucks, i was served frap in this cup, i didnt realised its actually a dine-in cup. I actually took the cup and walked out w me....then i realised its actually a hard plastic cup! in the end, i took home and use. LOL

Was just DENIED a cup when i went to Starbucks Singapore at 100AM, because not only you have to like this page, you'll have to like this post as well. This was not stated in the post, and i told the barista that i can like the post on the spot, but she said "No". What a disappointment.

I think you all should keep some redemption for the starbuck card member. 
I went northpoint and the said fully redeem. So is it true. Very disappointed!
Thank u starbucks. It was very nice of the company to give away cold cups however, pls put up a smile no doubt it's a giveaway & foc.
These people are non starbucks patron they just come and take and make a profit out of it. Thats why I say give to regular customers who are active for the past 1 month or so.
Rather misleading as the cold cup is a small-sized. But still, appreciate the effort.
Why bpp no starbucks?!?! 😭 Christina Chang

I think Starbucks should work on their customer service. So far, I think that orchard area staffs are ok but there are a selected few in other locations with pretty bad attitudes. Even though I have been patronizing here for years,  I am aware that there are so much more better quality coffees out there at the same value which I have come to realise. So I think you should improve in this aspect to retain customer loyalty.

Although Starbucks said that one person is only entitled to one. I saw people having all 3 sizes while me and my friends were denied saying it was out of stock. Is this an insider arrangement or just false marketing? Honestly, this is a very bad promotion and I doubt I will follow up from Tues and Fri since the same thing is gonna repeat. Very disappointed in Starbucks today. I left without a drink for the very first time in my life.

i went to Starbucks Singapore @ Clarke quay this morning and i was told by the barista that the cup didnt come free and i had to purchase a drink. but going through the post,it seems that the cup is free without any purchase. this is quite unfair and disappointing

2.post_text:
Only today, we're handing out a Cold Cup to followers of our Facebook page. 

Flash your smartphone at our baristas with proof of your "Like" for the page and be treated to a Cold Cup on us (limited to 1 redemption per follower, while stocks last).

Watch this space as we bring you new treats daily to enjoy from today 'til Friday.

3.post_text:
"People from different walks of life. People from different countries. That's what I like about it. You meet special people."

A love of "postcrossing" allows a group in Prague to connect with the world—and one another #atStarbucks.

15.post_text:
Hip hip hooray! This Children's Day, all kids (12 and below) get a tall Frappuccino on us with any purchase of a handcrafted beverage by an adult. 

Limited to 1 child per paying adult for redemption.

16.post_text:
Tomorrow's delight comes in the shape of a complimentary tall-sized Starbucks Frappuccino for a child (12 and below) with any purchase of a handcrafted beverage by an adult. Limited to 1 child per paying adult for redemption.

Happy Children's Day!

comments.message:
Hi Trudy Rosemund, Monice Cheung,

We're sorry but we made a slight mistake in the text which has been corrected. The complimentary tall-sized Frappuccino is meant for any child (12 and below) who is accompanied by an adult who purchases a handcrafted beverage of any size.

Apologies for any confusion caused.
